attributes.comment:
To Whom It May Concern:

I would like to express a concern in USCIS raising the rates for immigration and
adoption.

International adoption is a wonderful element and has provided many homes to
needy children. There is a perception, with the Angelina Jolie and Madonna
incidents, international adoption is only for the wealthy.

I have met many families who are so excited about the adoption proces as well as
the prospect of adopting. These are working class families who have taken the
time to stretch their financial and personal responsibilities to provide a home for
these children.

To increase rates further would continue to deter families as the international
adoption process requires not only time but significant monetary resources. Is
this really an areas where USCIS needs to make up a budgetary shortfall - an area
where American families are helping needy children and adding to the melting pot
that is our country? Is it right to punish a group who have had to go through so
much from a legal standpoint and then increase fees by 50%?

I urge you to reconsider this as increase as international adoption is a great thing
with tremendous momentum - it would be terrible if it is thought of as only
accessible to the rich.

Victor Woo

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Victor W. Woo
